p: Due to the high number of negative samples, in our previous study, we pursued OROV detection given that the genus Culicoides and Culex mosquitoes, which are the main vector for Oropouche fever, have been previously described in the region [ 22â€“ 24]. Surprisingly, OROV was detected in 26.4% (131/496) of cases and co-infections with DENV, ZIKV virus and CHIKV virus were also reported. This finding suggests that OROV was the second most prevalent arbovirus diagnosed in the study population [ 7].
